snippet: Trade in elephant tusks continues to thrive in China, even as conservation groups call on Beijing to do more to crack down on the slaughter of African elephants.
abstract: Trade in elephant tusks continues to thrive in China, even as conservation groups call on Beijing to do more to crack down on the slaughter of African elephants; illicit sales and poaching have boomed in five years since conservationists and governments agreed to a program of limited legal ivory sales (Series: The Price of Ivory).

byline.contributor: Shi Da and Mia Li contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Trade in elephant tusks continues to thrive in China, even as conservation groups call on Beijing to do more to crack down on the slaughter of African elephants.

headline.print_headline: From Elephants’ Mouths, an Illicit Trail to China
headline.seo: An Illicit Trail of African Ivory to China
headline.main: From Elephants’ Mouths, an Illicit Trail to China

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species
